ROBIN MEYER, MSOT, OTR/L

OCCUPATIONAL THERAPIST

CREDENTIALS
  • Master of Science, Occupational Therapy, University of Wisconsin – Madison
  • Bachelor of Arts, Anthropology and Spanish, Washington University in St. Louis
  • Completed advanced Leadership Education in Neurodevelopmental and Related Disabilities (LEND)
PROFESSIONAL

Robin is a licensed occupational therapist with experience supporting individuals and their families in schools, hospitals, clinics, and community-based programs. At Bridge House, she promotes residents’ engagement in their recovery journey by identifying and reducing environmental barriers to participation, helping individuals discover and meet their sensory needs, and supporting residents to identify and engage in activities that are important to them. Robin is committed to providing neurodiversity-affirming care that honors the unique learning style and interests of each individual.

PERSONAL

Outside of work Robin spends her time playing the piano, making and sharing meals with friends, enjoying the beauty of the mountains, learning DIY skills for house projects, and joining her young daughter in play. 

HOPE, HEALTH & HEALING

Robin believes that the need to do things is an essential part of being human. Participation in meaningful activities within a supportive environment opens the door to hope, health, and healing.

 Working in Mental Health Since 2018

Working at Bridge House Since 2023
